Build ID: M20071023-1652

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Open "package explorer" view
2.from the drop down menu, select "Select working set..." and click
3. see that nothing appears

we expected the dialog to open up

More information:
Something get broken recently. I can just guess that is something related to the new Android Eclipse plugin I have just installed. 
I get an exception in the error log, every time I click on the menu item:

I have to wonder if the same crash would occur if you're running a 1.5 VM.  Are you able to try on that platform?
Right now I am using 1.5 and Select... is working. But Eclipse crash continuously giving a JVM error. Here is a sample log that I will attach.

Created an attachment (id=83790)
eclipse crash continuously without any apparent cause. This is the error log

I'm guessing either your VM or your Eclipse installs are corrupt somehow.  I would suggest grabbing a fresh copy of eclipse from eclipse.org and installing everything anew.  Neither of the problems you've described has a sensible cause that I can come up with.  I'll leave the bug open until you give this a shot - if things are still screwy after a fresh install I'll dig a bit deeper.

(In reply to comment #1)
> I have to wonder if the same crash would occur if you're running a 1.5 VM.  Are
> you able to try on that platform?

This is rather odd. Does that mean that JFace was compiled at a 5.0 compatibility level? If that was the case, why didn't Eclipse just crash when it was loading a TreeViewer for the 'Package Explorer' view?

(In reply to comment #3)
> Created an attachment (id=83790) [details]
> eclipse crash continuously without any apparent cause. This is the error log

Do all the logs look the same with the MonoReconciler? Do you always have an editor open?
